metadata.title: CVE-2021-3609 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - high
metadata.description:
.A flaw was found in the CAN BCM networking protocol in the Linux kernel,where a local attacker can abuse a flaw in the CAN subsystem to corruptmemory, crash the system or escalate privileges. This race condition innet/can/bcm.c in the Linux kernel allows for local privilege escalation toroot.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3609` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required
